WRITING.TITLE: Xspice remote desktop for 3d games
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, Have been trying to run 3d games using Xspice, inside a docker container. Everything works fine, except when i try to run games. The mouse pointer is in relative mode which is correct: meaning that am using the remote desktop mouse. Problem is that the mouse movement does not corresponding to the movement inside the game. Hard to explain but the games is uncontrollable. Basically when I start to play, it becomes "crazy" and the game is out of control. If I press "esc" the mouse works normally. Does not matter which game i try, its the same. #8203; I have tried VNC aswell, has the same issue, but thats because it does not have support for relative mouse. #8203; Any help please? #8203; Edit: Take a look at the video: #8203; [https://streamable.com/4p8bf](https://streamable.com/4p8bf)
Have tried with different resolutions, with no luck.
I tried browser games also. Take a look at the video. #8203; [https://streamable.com/4p8bf](https://streamable.com/4p8bf)

Wont work with VNC, in FPS games. Because there is no VNC that supports Relative mouse motion. I have the same problem in Xspice, but should in theory work with Spice. Take a look at the video i made, showing the problem in HTML5 browser game. [https://streamable.com/4p8bf](https://streamable.com/4p8bf)

I used Proxmox to create an ubuntu VM with GPU passtrough. * Inside the vm i created a docker container with image from ubuntu:16.04 * Building Xspice * Spice-protocol 0.14 * Spice-server 0.14.2 * Spice-vdagent 0.19.0 * xf86-video-xql 0.1.4 with Xpsice #8203; I can also access the NVIDIA GPU inside the container with help of VirtualGL. but that's another story. #8203; Snippet from the Dockerfile: #8203; gt;\# spice-protocal gt; gt;RUN apt-get install -y libasound2-dev gt; gt;WORKDIR tmp gt; gt;RUN wget [https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice-protocol/uploads/f18acfa4a10482062b3f3484bddeb9fa/spice-protocol-0.14.0.$](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice-protocol/uploads/f18acfa4a10482062b3f3484bddeb9fa/spice-protocol-0.14.0.$) gt; gt;RUN tar -xjvf spice-protocol-0.14.0.tar.bz2 gt; gt;WORKDIR spice-protocol-0.14.0 gt; gt;RUN ./configure gt; gt;RUN make amp; amp; make install gt; gt;WORKDIR / gt; gt;\-------------------------------------- gt; gt;\## spice-server gt; gt;RUN apt-get install -y libssl-dev libjpeg-dev libopus-dev gt; gt;WORKDIR tmp gt; gt;RUN wget [https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice/uploads/4cddedac536f3343f50b8af03a4a5d41/spice-0.14.2.tar.bz2](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice/uploads/4cddedac536f3343f50b8af03a4a5d41/spice-0.14.2.tar.bz2) gt; gt;RUN tar -xjvf spice-0.14.2.tar.bz2 gt; gt;WORKDIR spice-0.14.2 gt; gt;RUN ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc \\ gt; gt;\--localstatedir=/var --libdir=/usr/lib gt; gt;\#--enable-gstreamer gt; gt;RUN make amp; amp; make install gt; gt;WORKDIR / gt; gt;\--------------------------------------------------- gt; gt;\# spice-vdagent gt; gt;WORKDIR tmp gt; gt;RUN wget [https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/linux/vd\_agent/uploads/c127f06b50f0f453ce1481440acdd6c8/spice-vdagent-0.19.0.t$](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/linux/vd_agent/uploads/c127f06b50f0f453ce1481440acdd6c8/spice-vdagent-0.19.0.t$) gt; gt;RUN tar -xjvf spice-vdagent-0.19.0.tar.bz2 gt; gt;WORKDIR spice-vdagent-0.19.0 gt; gt;RUN ./configure \\ gt; gt;\#--enable-static\_uinput gt; gt;RUN make amp; amp; make install gt; gt;WORKDIR / gt; gt;\------------------------------------------------- gt; gt;\# xf86-video-qxl also contains (xserver-xspice) gt; gt;RUN apt-get install -y xserver-xorg-core xutils-dev dh-autoreconf gt; gt;RUN apt-get install -y libpcsclite-dev libcacard-dev gt; gt;WORKDIR tmp gt; gt;RUN wget [http://xorg.freedesktop.org/releases/individual/driver/xf86-video-qxl-0.1.4.tar.bz2](http://xorg.freedesktop.org/releases/individual/driver/xf86-video-qxl-0.1.4.tar.bz2) gt; gt;RUN tar -xjvf xf86-video-qxl-0.1.4.tar.bz2 gt; gt;WORKDIR xf86-video-qxl-0.1.4 gt; gt;RUN autoreconf -i amp; amp; ./configure \\ gt; gt;\--enable-xspice \\ gt; gt;\--enable-ccid gt; gt;RUN make amp; amp; make install gt; gt;RUN cp src/.libs/spiceqxl\_drv.so /usr/lib/xorg/modules/drivers gt; gt;COPY spiceqxl.xorg.conf /etc/X11/ gt; gt;WORKDIR /
